description: 15th century. From dote (“to be foolish; senile”) +‎ -rel (“pejorative suffix”).  The bird is so named as it is easy to catch.

adjectives.description: dotterel (comparative more dotterel, superlative most dotterel)

entries.meaning: A gullible fool, especially an elderly person with impaired faculties. [from 15th c.]
examples: This poor dotterel, Sir Arthur, is playing fast and loose with me.

entries.meaning: A small brown-and-black bird, Charadrius morinellus, of the plover family. [from 15th c.]
(Australia, New Zealand) Any of various small birds of Australasia thought to resemble the Eurasian dotterel. [from 19th c.]
